settings.heading: HAIR TRANSPLANT & HAIR RESTORATION FOR WOMEN

settings.text:
Women’s hair loss has been grossly neglected and ignored for years. Over 35% of women experience some hair loss and thinning over their lifetimes. The psychological impact can be severe especially when women have nowhere to turn for solutions. Dr. Yates understands this painful issue and is committed to providing good medical and surgical options for hair restoration in females.

Women suffer from hair loss for various reasons: sometimes due to physical or emotional stress, pregnancy, hormone imbalances, autoimmune disorders or medical treatments such as chemotherapy. Women also experience hereditary balding or a thinning hairline similar to the male population. Some women have overall thinning, some have recessed hairlines and many African American females suffer from traction alopecia from tight braids and extensions. Women, like men, can also suffer from scarring alopecia. After medical evaluation and diagnosis, all of these issues can be addressed very successfully with hair transplantation. Female satisfaction with these procedures has been phenomenal!

Women’s appearances, self-confidence and esteem are dramatically improved. Dr. Yates customer satisfaction for this patient population is off the charts!

Dr. William Yates is dedicated to the unique medical, emotional and cosmetic needs of women experiencing hair loss. As the Midwest’s most comprehensive, full-service resource for the treatment of women at all stages of hair loss and prevention, we can help you get to the root of your problem, then find the solution that works best for you.

Dr. Yates is the hair restoration specialist you can trust; he has experience delivering beautiful results and giving confidence back to women experiencing hair loss. Conveniently located in the Chicago area, call Dr. Yates today to discuss your safe and affordable women’s hair loss treatment options, and start living your life today.

settings.title: WHO IS A GOOD CANDIDATE FOR FEMALE HAIR TRANSPLANTS?
settings.info:
• Women who have been diagnosed with traction alopecia
  • Women who have bald spots or patches of hair that is thinning
  • Women who are affected by androgenetic alopecia (genetic hair loss)
  • Women who suffered hair loss as the result of scars from cosmetic surgery
  • Women who suffered hair loss as the result of trauma
